intro: Dicrastylis doranii var. eriantha, commonly known as the silky dicrastylis, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, commonly known as the sedge family. The plant is characterized by its grass-like appearance, with narrow, linear leaves and small, clustered flowers. It typically grows in wet or seasonally flooded habitats, such as swampy areas or along riverbanks. The inflorescence consists of a dense cluster of spikelets, which are often covered in fine, silky hairs, giving the plant its common name.
